EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK | PAYSYS LABS (PVT.) LTD. 
 
Introduction to Handbook 
1.1. Purpose 
 
This Handbook is intended to provide employees with a general understanding of 
some of the Company's personnel policies. It is not an employment contract or a 
legal   document.   The   information   in   this   Handbook   should   be   helpful   in 
familiarizing employees with the Company. 
 
This Handbook cannot anticipate every situation or answer every question about 
employment.  Rather,  this  Handbook  serves  as  guideline  to  your  employment 
relationship  with  Company.  From  time  to  time,  circumstances  will  undoubtedly 
require  that  the  policies, practices  and  benefits  described  in  the  Handbook  be 
changed. Accordingly, other than  the at-will relationship set forth above, which 
can only be altered by a written agreement signed by both you and a designated 
officer  of  the  company,  Company  reserves  their  right  to  modify,  supplement  or

can only be altered by a written agreement signed by both you and a designated 
officer  of  the  company,  Company  reserves  their  right  to  modify,  supplement  or 
rescind any provision of the Handbook as it deems necessary. If any changes to 
the Handbook become necessary, the Company will endeavor to notify you of such 
changes by distributing revised pages to you. Please keep your Handbook readily 
available and insert updated material promptly so that it is current at all times. 
When  new  policies  are  added  or  existing  policies  are  changed,  the  most  recent 
policy shall prevail and govern any new action taken. Throughout this Handbook, 
we have often used the words “he”, “him” and “his” when the meaning includes 
“she”, “her” and “hers”. This wording is used solely for ease of reading and should 
not be interpreted as any form of bias. This Handbook supersedes any and all prior 
verbal or written policies or procedures of the Company.

8 
EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK | PAYSYS LABS (PVT.) LTD. 
1.2. Welcome Note 
 
Welcome to Paysys Labs. We consider the employees of Paysys Labs to be one of 
its most valuable resources. We sincerely hope that your position with us is both 
rewarding and enjoyable. You can make a difference! 
This Employee Handbook is not a contract of employment. It was written to help 
you  get  acquainted  our  Company,  to  give  you  a  brief  explanation  of  our 
philosophy, and to outline some of our policies and procedures. The Handbook will 
not answer all of your questions, but it will serve as a guideline to your relationship 
with  Paysys  Labs.  Remember,  always  feel  free  to  approach  any  member  of  our 
management team with your questions. 
Our   success   is   based   on   the   personal   attention   and   contributions   of   our 
employees. As a new member of the team, you will make a difference. We will be

Our   success   is   based   on   the   personal   attention   and   contributions   of   our 
employees. As a new member of the team, you will make a difference. We will be 
depending on YOU. We are proud you joined our Company and extend to you a 
warm WELCOME! 
 
 
 
Sincerely 
 
 
Karim Jindani 
CEO – Paysys Labs Pvt. Ltd.

9 
EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK | PAYSYS LABS (PVT.) LTD. 
 
1.3. About Paysys Labs 
 
PAYSYS  LABS  is  a  Boutique  Payments  and  Retail,  Digital  Financial  Product 
Development and Project Management company located in Karachi, Pakistan. 
From  the  conceptualization  phase,  PAYSYS  helps  clients  by  understanding  their 
needs, drawing up business cases for digitization, preparing financial models for 
building  up  self-sustaining  services.  We  provide  reliable  and  secure  technology 
platforms  that  enable  Banks,  Telcos  and  various  Businesses  to  offer  their 
customers a vast array of financial solution, across multiple channels, anywhere 
at any time.  
We  have  solutions  ranging  from  Card  /  Mobile  Wallet  Issuance,  Universal 
Payment    Gateway,    Mobile    Banking,    Merchant    and    also    offer    project 
management   services.   We   provide   solutions   to   the   electronic   and   mobile

Payment    Gateway,    Mobile    Banking,    Merchant    and    also    offer    project 
management   services.   We   provide   solutions   to   the   electronic   and   mobile 
commerce ready segments as well as the unbanked and underserved population 
by introducing new, innovative and consumer centric product offerings in various 
industry  verticals,  such  as  Banking,  Telecommunication,  Insurance,  Cash-On-
Delivery  (COD),  Transport,  Courier  services,  Health  Services  and  Government 
Payments (P2G & G2P). 
Our Product Offerings include: 
• Online Payment Gateway Solution 
• Enterprise Mobile Banking Application 
• Mobile Point-of-Sale Solution 
• Digital Financial CRM (Customer Relationship Management) Solution 
• Integrated Debit and Prepaid Card Solutions 
• Customized Software Development 
• Digital Financial Services Consultancy 
• API    (Application    Programming    Interface) Management    Platform, 
Implementation and Support Services

EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK | PAYSYS LABS (PVT.) LTD. 
2. Company Policies 
 
2.1. Confidentiality 
 
It is responsibility of all employees to protect the interests of Paysys Labs. In the course of 
employment, you may have access to corporate information that is non-public, confidential, 
disclosure  of which may be harmful to the Company and  business  activities. You must 
maintain strict confidentiality of such information concerning the company and its business 
activities.  
This prohibition not only applies to employees during the term of their employment with the 
Company, but also applicable to all employees after their separation from the Company.  
Violations  of  this  policy  by  existing  employees  will  result  in  disciplinary  action  up  to  and 
including termination and may, depending upon the severity of the breach of confidentiality, 
result in legal action against the active or past employee. 
 
2.2. Company Property

including termination and may, depending upon the severity of the breach of confidentiality, 
result in legal action against the active or past employee. 
 
2.2. Company Property 
 
Employees  must  be  careful  about  all  company  properties. You are expected to handle all 
company property  correctly and  should if  you cause loss or damage  to company property 
through neglect or misuse, necessary disciplinary action will be taken against you. 
 
2.3. Data Protection 
 
The Company will hold personal information about you that will
 include details such as your 
name, date of birth, address, bank details and your emergency contact details. Also, we may 
hold personal information such as health and sickness information, details of your parents, 
spouse, and  kids  (for  medical  insurance  purpose), criminal records and  any membership  of 
trade unions. This  information  is for the use of the Company payroll and  other  benefits

spouse, and  kids  (for  medical  insurance  purpose), criminal records and  any membership  of 
trade unions. This  information  is for the use of the Company payroll and  other  benefits 
functions. We will not disclose your personal details to any organization without your written 
consent.

12 
EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK | PAYSYS LABS (PVT.) LTD. 
2.4. Dress Code 
 
All  employees  are  expected  to  dress  in  a  manner  consistent  with  good  hygiene,  safety  and 
good  taste. It is in everyone’s best interest for all employees of the Company to present a 
professional  image  to  customers,  clients,  visitors and  the  public.  Cleanliness  is  an  essential 
part of providing this image. A neat, clean, businesslike appearance is a requirement for all 
jobs.  
Formal  dressing  is  recommended  in  office  for  all  staff. The  mode  of  dress may vary in 
accordance with the type of work performed. For example, office personnel are required to 
wear  clothes  appropriate  to  a  business  office  environment.  Employees  whose  jobs  require 
them to come in contact with customers, clients or the public are expected to wear apparel 
consistent  with  that  worn  by  persons  dealing  with  the  public  in  the  community  in  similar

them to come in contact with customers, clients or the public are expected to wear apparel 
consistent  with  that  worn  by  persons  dealing  with  the  public  in  the  community  in  similar 
capacities. Any employee who has a question about whether an item or outfit is appropriate 
should  discuss  the  matter  with their supervisor  before  wearing  it.  Employees  who  are 
inappropriately dressed may be directed to return and come to work in proper attire. 
 
2.5. Equal Employment Opportunity  
 
The   Company is committed to the principles of equal
 opportunity in employment and does 
not  discriminate  employee  or  applicant  because  of  actual  or  perceived  age,  race,  gender, 
ethnicity, religion, political affiliation. When recruiting, hiring, developing, promoting, pay and 
interacting with employees and service providers, people will be treated fairly, uniformly and 
without prejudice.

interacting with employees and service providers, people will be treated fairly, uniformly and 
without prejudice.  
The responsibility for the development and implementation of the recruitment and selection 
policy rests with the Human Resource Department of Paysys Labs.

13 
EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK | PAYSYS LABS (PVT.) LTD. 
 
 
3. Rules for Employment 
 
To ensure transparency and fairness in hiring process candidates are recruited through proper 
hiring  mechanism  by advertising,  indiscriminate head-hunting using  database  of  credible 
recruitment firms/portals/digital media firm candidates. Once applications are received short 
listing is  done through  independent  sources  or  cross  checking  through reference  checks  or 
under an already laid down eligibility Performa followed by tests and interviews by a panel. 
These are some of the effective ways of recruitment. In short, any such policy that ensures 
transparency and a non-partisan approach can be termed as a fair recruitment policy 
While entertaining applications from applicants the following procedure will be followed; 
3.1)  Applications shall  be  made  by submission  of comprehensive  resume  that  provides

While entertaining applications from applicants the following procedure will be followed; 
3.1)  Applications shall  be  made  by submission  of comprehensive  resume  that  provides 
detailed information related to an applicant's work and educational experience. 
3.2) Skills tests, which are required for certain positions, shall be given to all applicants for the 
position. All examinations shall be uniformly administered by Human Resource Department. 
3.3) An  official  transcript  will  be  required  in  support  of  an  application  for  any  positions  at 
Paysys Labs in which a bachelor's or higher degree is required. 
3.4) No verbal promises of future salary increases, higher-level positions or promotions shall 
be  made  by  the organization’s employees  as  an  inducement  to  prospective  employees  to 
accept employment within the organization. Any such promises shall not be honored unless

be  made  by  the organization’s employees  as  an  inducement  to  prospective  employees  to 
accept employment within the organization. Any such promises shall not be honored unless 
included  as  part  of  the  official  letter  offering  employment  signed by  the  Chief  Executive 
Officer.

one  or  more  of  the  requirements  essential  for  that  position  being  advertised.  Applications 
may also be rejected if the applicant is known to be a current user of illegal drugs; has a record 
of conviction of crime related to the responsibilities of the position that might directly impact 
on the position for which the applicant has applied; has made false statements of any material 
fact in his/her application or resume; or has a past employment record which is unsatisfactory 
as determined by the Human Resource Department.

2 Employees who leave the organization in good standing are eligible for rehire. 
 
Paysys Labs prohibits manipulation by the employees for employment of their son, daughter 
and spouse.  Any candidates being considered for employment that have relatives currently 
employed by the Company must declare this information at the initiation of the recruitment

Age Limit: Minimum age required for a job with the Company is eighteen years. 
 
4. Probation period 
 
The probationary period is intended to give new employees the opportunity to demonstrate 
their ability to achieve a satisfactory level of performance and to determine whether the new 
position  meets  their  expectations.  The  Company  uses  this  period  to  evaluate  employee 
capabilities, work habits, and overall performance. Probationary Period for all new employees 
is three months from the date of hiring. 
Your appointment will be confirmed on satisfactory completion of the probationary period. 
During  this  probationary  period,  you  will  be  given  appropriate  support  and  development

Your appointment will be confirmed on satisfactory completion of the probationary period. 
During  this  probationary  period,  you  will  be  given  appropriate  support  and  development 
opportunity to help you reach the required standards. Extension of the probationary period 
may be granted to enable the required standards to be achieved, but failure to do so could 
result in termination of your employment.

15 
EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK | PAYSYS LABS (PVT.) LTD. 
5. Resignation & Termination  
5.1  During Probation Period: 
 
• If any employee resigns, he/she would not get the experience letter. The salary for the 
served  time  period  would  only  be  issued  after  serving  a  notice  period  of thirty  (30) 
days.  
• Your appointment may be terminated at any time subject to the following conditions: 
o If in the company’s opinion, which will be final and binding in this matter, you 
are found guilty of Company’s confidential data theft, dishonesty, misconduct, 
disorderly  behavior,  negligence,  indiscipline,  insubordination,  absence  from 
duty  without  permission, low  performance or  having  any  conduct  which 
violates company interest. 
o In  case  of  termination,  the  management  reserves  the  right  to  terminate  the 
employment contract on immediate basis or giving to the other a thirty (30)

served time period will be issued. 
o During probation, if any employee takes 2 unapproved or uninformed leaves, 
the  company  have  right  to  terminate  his/her  employment  without  any  prior 
notice.

letter. Also, the management reserves the right to reduce the notice period. In such 
cases, the employee will be paid salary for the time served.

5.3 Work From Home (WFH) And Other Policies for Employees on 
Notice Period: 
a. Staff on notice period are not allowed to work from home. In special circumstances 
and prior written approval by Team Lead, the staff may be allowed only 1 work from 
home day per month. 
b. Staff  on  notice  period  are  not  eligible  for referral,  leave  encashment or yearly 
performance bonuses.  
c. If an employee has unnecessarily worked from home during their notice period (i.e.,

performance bonuses.  
c. If an employee has unnecessarily worked from home during their notice period (i.e., 
without the consent of their Line Manager) or has majorly served less hours per week 
than required, deductions will be made and will be adjusted during their full and final 
settlement.  
5.4 Notice Period Buy-back Policy: 
 
This policy applies to all permanent employees of the organization, excluding those in 
managerial roles. 
1. Company Discretion on Notice Period: 
When an employee resigns and requests an early release, the company reserves the 
right to: 
      a.   Shorten the notice period and release the employee earlier, or 
      b.   Require the employee to serve the full notice period as per their employment terms 
and the discretion of their Team Lead (TL). 
These decisions are made at the sole discretion of the company and are not subject to 
employee preference.

17 
EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK | PAYSYS LABS (PVT.) LTD. 
• Buy Back Option by Employee: 
o If the company chooses to have the employee serve the full notice period, and the 
employee still wishes to leave earlier, they may request a buy back of the remaining 
notice period. 
o This option is only available to permanent, non-managerial employees. 
• Process for Buy Back Request: 
o If the employee decides to leave early and this is not approved by the company, the 
employee can submit a formal request to HR for the buy-back of the unserved 
portion of the notice period. 
o HR will evaluate the request and calculate the Full and Final Settlement (F&F), 
including the amount payable by the employee corresponding to the unserved days. 
o Upon approval and payment of the specified amount, the employee may be released 
before completing the full notice period. 
5.5 Full and Final Settlement: 
• In  order  to  receive  full  and  final  settlement  the  employee  needs  to  ensure  the  exit

before completing the full notice period. 
5.5 Full and Final Settlement: 
• In  order  to  receive  full  and  final  settlement  the  employee  needs  to  ensure  the  exit 
process has completed.  
• The exit process of employees includes: 
1) Exit Interview with HR 
2) Proper handover of documents, data and projects to the team leader  
3) Getting   the   exit   checklist   signed   by   his   /   her   team   lead   and   all   relevant 
departments (Admin, Finance, Network, HR) and submitting it to HR  
After the submission of exit check list, the full and final settlement of employee will be settled 
in 45 working days.  
6 Conflict of Interest 
 
Employee must  disclose his/her supervisor  of  any  outside  business  activities  or  alternate 
employment you may have. Although you are free to do as you wish on your own time, no 
employee  should  engage  in  activities  which  are  in  direct  competition  with  the  Company.  If

employment you may have. Although you are free to do as you wish on your own time, no 
employee  should  engage  in  activities  which  are  in  direct  competition  with  the  Company.  If 
your  outside  employment  affects  your  ability  to  satisfactorily  perform  your  job  with  us,  we 
may request that you relinquish your alternate employment. 
Employees  may  from  time  to  receive  a  gift  from  a  vendor,  supplier  or  other  business 
acquaintance. This policy will define procedures to ensure that gifts do not influence business 
decisions, transactions or service.  
To  avoid  any  suggestion  of  impropriety,  the  Company  requires  that  employees  decline 
accepting gifts having significant value from individuals or entities that transact, or desire to 
transact, business with the Company. For gifts, trips, etc., the employee must have his or her 
direct manager’s approval before accepting gifts, trips, etc.

transact, business with the Company. For gifts, trips, etc., the employee must have his or her 
direct manager’s approval before accepting gifts, trips, etc.  
This  policy  is  designed  to  protect  employees  from  potential  conflicts  of  interest.  Gift  givers 
may incorrectly assume that they earned favored status or that an employee is beholden to

18 
EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK | PAYSYS LABS (PVT.) LTD. 
them.  Colleagues  and  fellow  employees  may  view  the  acceptance  of  a  gift  suspiciously  and 
may conclude that an employee who accepts a gift is unable to act objectively and without 
bias. 
To  avoid  any  internal  conflict  of  interest  situations  related  to  new  hiring  or  referrals,  it  is 
important to adhere to clear guidelines and policies. 
 
a) If an individual, Mr./Miss/Mrs. "XYZ," applies to Paysys Labs for any position: 
1. Any existing employee or associate, regardless of their position, who has prior knowledge of 
the applicant based on professional, family, or personal reasons, must disassociate themselves

7.1 Attendance Accountability Policy: 
 
All employees are required to mark their daily attendance using the biometric machine, 
which automatically syncs with FlowHCM. Manual attendance marking in FlowHCM should be 
used strictly as an exception and not a regular practice. The month-end reconciliation is done 
via FlowHCM, so any employee whose monthly attendance is not present in FlowHCM will 
face a salary deduction equivalent to one day's pay for each unmarked day, regardless of 
work performed. Excessive manual markings will also negatively impact the employee's 
annual appraisal, reflecting non-compliance with company protocols. Repeated offenses may 
lead to further disciplinary action, including formal warnings. 
Exception: Employees who are traveling for work or are deputed to a client site are exempted 
from this policy, provided prior notification and approval are documented in FlowHCM.

7.2     Attendance Integrity Policy: 
 
Manual marking of attendance in FlowHCM should only be used in exceptional 
circumstances. To ensure the integrity of working hours, all manual attendance entries will be 
subject to random checks by the HR department using CCTV camera feeds. A leeway of only 
10-15 minutes will be allowed for discrepancies. If an employee is found to have 
misrepresented their arrival time or departure time using manual attendance, HR reserves 
the right to deduct up to 75% of their salary from the payroll for that month. Repeated 
instances will lead to further disciplinary actions, including the right of HR to terminate the 
employee with immediate effect, without providing any notice.

9 Leaves 
 
9.1  Annual Leaves  
 
All permanent employees of company are entitled to leaves of 30 working days on 1st 
January of every calendar year (including casual, sick, annual). Where an employee has 
joined or leaves during a calendar year, he will be entitled to prorated annual leaves 
according to his/her date of joining. Maximum of 15 calendar days of annual leave could 
be availed at one stretch once during the year. The remaining leaves may be taken in 
multiple blocks of time. Un-availed leaves may not be carried forward to next year and 
will be treated as lapsed. However, only up to 5 days’ leave will be encashed (subject to 
conditions in Section 9.8). Any continuous leaves for 5 or more days will be counted as 
Block Leaves or Annual Leaves. (Weekends or gazette holidays falling before or after any 
leaves are part of block leaves). Employees and their supervisors must pre plan their

Block Leaves or Annual Leaves. (Weekends or gazette holidays falling before or after any 
leaves are part of block leaves). Employees and their supervisors must pre plan their 
leaves. Please check the Policy number 9.2 for detail.  
 
- The supervisor should ensure that employees are able to avail their annual leaves 
while managing the team work in a way that the backup resources in the team are able to 
carry out the tasks. To achieve this supervisors need to ensure proper documentation of 
all the work.  
 
- In case an employee repeatedly request planned annual leaves and does not get 
approval from supervisor they will raise it to HR to address this. All leave requests will be 
entered in FLOW HCM (the official system) provided by company. All employees must 
take responsibilities of adding their leaves proactively.

11 Disciplinary Policy 
 
11.1 Smoking  
 
For   health   and   safety   considerations,   the   Company   discourages   smoking.   Smoking   is 
prohibited in company premises except in the area specifically designated as smoking area. 
 
11.2 Harassment 
 
Paysys Labs is committed to providing a workplace that is free from any sort of harassment. 
Harassment in the workplace is against the law and will not be tolerated. When the company 
determines  that  an  allegation  of any harassment  is  credible,  it  will  take  prompt  and 
appropriate corrective action. Company has zero tolerance policy on harassment of any sort 
and would immediately terminate the services of an employee found guilty of such offense. 
Any employee found facilitating or involved in the harassment will face the same disciplinary 
action as the harasser. 
11.3 Personal Harassment

Any employee found facilitating or involved in the harassment will face the same disciplinary 
action as the harasser. 
11.3 Personal Harassment 
 
Personal  harassment  shall  be  defined  as:  any behavior which  denies  and/or  undermines 
individuals their health, dignity and respect, and that is offensive, embarrassing and humiliating 
to  said  individual,  therefore,  personal  harassment  of  another  employee  in  carrying  out  the 
duties  or  in  the  provision  of  his/her  services  in  any  form  and  at  any  level,  whether  it  be 
colleague to colleague, supervisor to subordinate, or subordinate to supervisor, constitutes a 
disciplinary infraction.  
 
The  Employer  endorses  the  right  of  every  employee  to  work  in  an  environment  free  from 
harassment and employees are free to pursue all avenues in the Employer’s policy, including 
the grievance procedure as defined in section 19, for resolving complaints of harassment that 
may arise.

the grievance procedure as defined in section 19, for resolving complaints of harassment that 
may arise. 
 
11.4 What Is Sexual Harassment? 
 
Unwelcome sexual advances, requests for sexual favors, and other verbal or physical conduct 
of a sexual nature constitute sexual harassment when:  
a.  An  employment  decision  affecting  that  individual  is  made  because  the  individual 
submitted to or rejected the unwelcome conduct; or

32 
EMPLOYEE HANDBOOK | PAYSYS LABS (PVT.) LTD. 
b.  The   unwelcome   conduct   unreasonably   interferes   with   an   individual's   work 
performance or creates an intimidating, hostile, or abusive work environment. 
Certain  behaviors,  such  as  conditioning  promotions,  awards,  training  or  other  job  benefits 
upon acceptance of unwelcome actions of a sexual nature, are always wrong. 
Unwelcome   actions   such   as   the   following   are   inappropriate   and,   depending   on   the

contribute to a hostile work environment: 
• Sexual pranks, or repeated sexual teasing, jokes, or innuendo, in person or via e-mail; 
• Verbal abuse of a sexual nature. 
• Touching or grabbing of a sexual nature. 
• Repeatedly standing too close to or brushing up against a person.

• Making  or  posting  sexually  demeaning  or  offensive  pictures, cartoons, or  other

• Off-duty, unwelcome conduct of a sexual nature that affects the work environment. 
A victim of sexual harassment can be a man or a woman. The victim can be of the same sex 
as the harasser. The harasser can be a supervisor, co-worker, other Department employee, or 
a non-employee who has a business relationship with the Department.

a non-employee who has a business relationship with the Department.

13 Information Security Policy 
 
13.1 Overview  
Consistent  standards,  specifically  in  relation  to  network/system  access/authentication  and 
acceptable  use, are critical  to  the company's information  security  and  are  often  required  by 
regulations  or  third-party agreements.  Any  user  accessing  the  company's  computer  systems 
has the ability to affect the security of all users of, and all data held within, the network. 
 
 
13.2 Purpose  
The  purpose  of  this  policy  is  to  describe  what  steps  must  be  taken  to ensure  that  users 
connecting to the corporate network are: 
1. Authenticated in an appropriate manner, in compliance with company standards 
2. Given the least amount of access required to perform their job function 
3. Using strong password and reuse of password 
4. Aware of their responsibilities if using their own personal device 
 
13.3 Scope

3. Using strong password and reuse of password 
4. Aware of their responsibilities if using their own personal device 
 
13.3 Scope  
The scope of this policy includes all users who have access to company-owned or company-
provided computers or require access to the corporate network and/or systems. 
 
13.4 Policy  
During initial account setup, certain checks must be performed in order to ensure the 
integrity of the process. The following policies apply to account setup: 
• Positive ID and coordination with Human Resources is required. 
• Users will be granted least amount of network access required to perform his or her 
job function 
• Users will be granted access only if he or she accepts the Acceptable Use Policy 
• Access to the network will be granted in accordance with the Acceptable Use Policy. 
• Each user has individual access/username/privilege granted as per company policy 
procedures. 
 
13.4.  Account Use

• Each user has individual access/username/privilege granted as per company policy 
procedures. 
 
13.4.  Account Use 
All accounts such as Email, SSL-VPN, System, etc. must be use as per company policy below 
• All accounts had standard username. 
• All accounts must be password protected as per standard policy. 
• User account sharing is strictly prohibited. 
• User must change their password frequently, at least once in 90 days. 
• Do not reuse password at least 4 old passwords. 
• In case of any suspicion of password compromised user must inform HOD OR relevant 
team for password change request. 
• Any additional access for account must be process via access request form.

13.4.2 Screensaver Passwords/Locked Computers 
Screensaver  passwords  /  locked  computers  offer  an  easy  way  to  strengthen  security  by 
removing  the opportunity  for  a  malicious  user,  curious  employee,  or  intruder  to  access 
network resources through an idle computer. For this reason, screensaver passwords / locked 
computers (Ctrl. Alt. Delete) are encouraged. 
13.4.3 Account Termination 
When  managing  network  and  user  accounts,  it  is  important  to  stay  in  communication  with 
Human Resources so that when an employee no longer works at the company, that employee's 
account   can be   disabled.   Human   Resources   must create   a   process   to   notify   the 
Communications   Lead   in   the   event of   a   staffing   change,   which   includes   employment 
termination,  employment  suspension,  or  a  change of  job  function  (promotion,  demotion, 
suspension, etc.).

15  Employee Emergency Loan Policy 
 
15.1 Objective 
This policy defines the criteria of employee loan for the employee of Paysys Labs (Pvt) 
Limited, the process to obtain and repayment policy of that loan. 
15.2 Eligibility Criteria 
a. This policy is applicable to permanent employees who have completed at least one 
year of employment. In exceptional cases, loan request cases received from 
employees with less than one year of employment in the organization can be 
considered by Senior Management’s consent. 
b. Employee Loan will be available to meet the basic needs and for emergency purpose. 
15.3 Limitation 
 
a. Loan requests are submitted to HR, which will share it with the Management forum 
comprising of team leads which reviews the cases.  
 
b. Management forum shall determine the size of Employee Loan Pool/Fund at start of 
each financial year. The size of the Fund shall determine the maximum amount of

b. Management forum shall determine the size of Employee Loan Pool/Fund at start of 
each financial year. The size of the Fund shall determine the maximum amount of 
loan that shall be available to be obtain collectively by all the employees of company 
such that at any given time during the year total loan obtain by all the employees 
shall not exceed fund size. Management forum may review and change the size of 
fund during the year based on growth of company. 
 
The fund size defined currently is Rs. 5,000,000/- 
 
c. The maximum loan limit for an individual employee shall be the amount equal to 4.8 
times of his/ her Gross Salary OR Rs. 500,000/-, whichever is lower. 
15.4 Repayment 
 
a. Maximum loan repayment period shall not exceed 24 months following the month in 
which loan obtain, whereby in any case minimum monthly repayment shall not be less 
than 8% of individual’s monthly salary. 
b. Repayment shall be made by deducting monthly installment from payroll processing.

than 8% of individual’s monthly salary. 
b. Repayment shall be made by deducting monthly installment from payroll processing. 
c. Repayment shall start from next month’s payroll from the month in which loan is 
obtained. 
d. No   relaxation   on   deduction   of   loan   repayment   shall be available. In   extreme 
circumstances,  where  there  is  a  genuine  need, such employee  shall  request  to  defer 
the  deduction  to  the  Human  Resource  Department.  On  approval  deduction  shall  be 
deferred for one month. 
e. If there is any outstanding loan of an employee who has crossed 24 months repayment 
time or an employee who is on a notice period such outstanding loans shall be adjusted 
against the employee’s financial benefits/incentives.  
f. All financial benefits / incentives of an employee who has an outstanding loan, shall be adjusted 
against his/her outstanding loan.

15.6 Loan Acceptance Policy: 
 
This policy  defines  the  criteria  and  evaluation  process  for  accepting  or  rejecting 
employee loan applications, ensuring transparency and financial responsibility. 
Eligibility: 
All employees requesting a loan will be assessed based on their prior repayment history 
and the time elapsed since their most recent loan closure. 
Rejection Probability Calculation: 
Loan requests will be evaluated using the following formula to determine the probability 
of rejection: 
F = [(n + 1) × 3.25] / (t + 1) 
Where: 
n = Total number of fully repaid loans (with no 12-month restriction)

of rejection: 
F = [(n + 1) × 3.25] / (t + 1) 
Where: 
n = Total number of fully repaid loans (with no 12-month restriction) 
t = Full months since the most recent loan was fully repaid 
F = Rejection factor 
Decision Criteria: 
If F ≥ 1 → The loan application will be automatically rejected. 
If F < 1 → The rejection probability will be calculated as F × 100%, and the application 
will be evaluated further by the HR and Finance teams. 
Approval Process: 
All  loan  applications  are  subject  to  final  review  and  approval  by  HR  and  Finance, 
considering  the  rejection  probability, current  financial  obligations,  and  organizational 
loan pool capacity.

OPD or Outpatient Department treatment refers treatments and diagnosis done on advice of 
a medical practitioner or doctor, by simply visiting their clinic or even a doctor's consultation. 
The important distinction is that OPD treatments DO NOT require hospitalization and are not 
part of the Insurance package. 
17.2 Objective

employees of Paysys Labs (Pvt) Limited. 
17.3 Eligibility Criteria 
 
a. This policy is applicable to permanent employees of Paysys Labs. 
b. OPD Pool will be available for medical emergency needs of employees.

20 Prohibition of Financial Dealings with Clients: 
 
To uphold the uncompromising integrity and ethical foundation of our company, all 
employees are hereby strictly forbidden from engaging in any and all financial transactions or 
dealings with clients, without exception. This encompasses any form of borrowing, lending, 
or entering into financial agreements, whether informal or formal. Any violation of this policy 
will be met with the most severe consequences, including immediate termination of 
employment and legal prosecution to the fullest extent permitted by law. There will be no 
warnings or progressive discipline; a single infraction will incur the maximum penalty. 
Furthermore, we expect our employees to report any knowledge or suspicion of such

warnings or progressive discipline; a single infraction will incur the maximum penalty. 
Furthermore, we expect our employees to report any knowledge or suspicion of such 
violations immediately through our confidential reporting mechanism. Let it be known that 
this policy is absolute, and adherence is not optional but mandatory for all employees, 
safeguarding the integrity and reputation of our company at all times.

23.        Farewell Dinner Policy: 
23.1.     Purpose 
To recognize and appreciate employees who have made meaningful contributions during 
their tenure with the company. 
23.2.     Eligibility 
• Farewell events are not mandatory for all departing employees. 
• A company-sponsored farewell may be arranged for employees who have completed 
a minimum of 3 years of service. 
23.3     Budget and Group Size 
• Team Leads and peers may organize a farewell lunch or dinner as a gesture of 
appreciation. 
• The recommended budget is PKR 2,000 per person. 
• The group size should be limited to 10 to 15 attendees. 
• Any exceptions to the budget or group size must be pre-approved by HR. 
23.4.     Request Process 
• The Team Lead must submit a formal request to HR at least 5 working days in 
advance. 
• The request must include: 
o Name of the departing employee 
o List of invitees 
o Proposed date and time

24.        Reimbursement Policy: 
24.1.     Purpose 
 
This policy outlines the guidelines for claiming and disbursing reimbursements related to official 
expenses incurred by employees during the course of their duties. 
24.2.    Submission Process 
 
• All claims must be submitted through Flow HCM with complete and valid supporting 
documentation. 
• Claims must be submitted within 10 working days of incurring the expense. 
• Team Lead (TL) approval is mandatory for the processing of claims. 
24.3.    Disbursement Timeline 
 
All official reimbursements (meals, conveyance, travel, and other official expenses) submitted and 
approved through Flow HCM will be disbursed on the 15th day of the month following the approval 
date by the respective Team Lead.
